intro: Mollia burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water absorption. Mollia burchellii is also known for its milky sap, which is toxic and serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
